intro: Tephrosia rutenbergiana, commonly known as the Rutenberg's tephrosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is known to contain compounds with potential medicinal properties. Tephrosia rutenbergiana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
